definition: to dazzle/to boast/to show off/(slang) cool/awesome
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: Pedantry is the unseasonable ostentation of learning.
sentences.chinese: “炫學者”，不合季節賣弄學問的人。

sentences.english: One of the cool features of this board is its high level of customizability.
sentences.chinese: 其中的酷炫功能的這個委員會是其高水平的定製。

sentences.english: Well this site works similarly, but has some other cool features.
sentences.chinese: 以及本網站的作品同樣的，但有一些其他的酷炫功能。

sentences.english: Master one really cool magic trick.
Stand body, double vibration low-sounding, limpidity key-press, seven Color Dazzles the colored lantern.
sentences.chinese: 金屬外觀，雙震動低音喇叭，玻璃按鍵，七色炫彩燈。

sentences.english: This theme of creating a fresh and innovative "Unveil" will also be represented by other academic disciplines offered by Raffles-BICT International College.
sentences.chinese: “炫”這一主題也將通過學院的其他各系反應出來。

sentences.english: This clan was potlatched by a neighbouring clan.
sentences.chinese: 這個部落被鄰近部落舉行的炫財冬宴所壓倒。

sentences.english: Complaining about a lottery talent in the second round is lame.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟在第二輪選中樂透選手是很炫的事。

sentences.english: But we called the book "Being Geek" because that sounds great.
sentences.chinese: 但我的書叫做《做個怪咖》是因爲聽起來很炫。

sentences.english: The hipster is a scholar of social forms, a student of cool.
sentences.chinese: ‘潮人’是研究社會形態的知識分子，是酷炫的學生。

sentences.english: Why is Kim Jong-hyun that she can be so close?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼她可以和金鐘炫這麼親近？

sentences.english: Can you share some of the cool things you do with Open APIs?
sentences.chinese: 您是否願意分享一下用開放API做了什麼炫玩意兒？

sentences.english: So where are all the great iPad games?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，ipad的酷炫遊戲到底在何方呢？

sentences.english: In short , nothing new good compared to Turion 64 of first generation.
sentences.chinese: 總之，任何新的比較好，以64炫的第一代。

sentences.english: The special effects in that movie were phat.
sentences.chinese: 那部電影裏的特效真是太炫了。

definition: handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears
to be in defiance of the natural order
bow case or scabbard/to hide/military strategy
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
